holidays.name: New Year's Day
holidays.description: New Year's Day is the first day of the Gregorian calendar, which is widely used in many countries such as the USA.

holidays.name: Martin Luther King Jr. Day
holidays.description: Martin Luther King Day marks the anniversary of the date of birth of the influential American civil right leader of the same name.

holidays.name: Presidents' Day
holidays.description: Washington's Birthday, or Presidents' Day, honors the life and work of the first president of the United States, George Washington.

holidays.name: Memorial Day
holidays.description: Memorial Day commemorates all Americans who have died in military service for the United States.

holidays.name: Independence Day (substitute)
holidays.description: On Independence Day, Americans celebrate the anniversary of publication of the Declaration of Independence from Great Britain in 1776.

holidays.name: Labor Day
holidays.description: Labor Day is a federal holiday in the United States. It gives workers a day of rest and it celebrates their contribution to the American economy.

holidays.name: Columbus Day
holidays.description: Columbus Day celebrates 15th century explorer Christopher Columbus's arrival in America in 1492.

holidays.name: Veterans Day
holidays.description: Veterans Day in the USA is a holiday to honor all who have served in the United States Military Services.

holidays.name: Thanksgiving Day
holidays.description: Thanksgiving Day in the United States is traditionally a holiday to give thanks for the food collected at the end of the harvest season.

holidays.name: Christmas Eve
holidays.description: Christmas Eve in the United States is on December 24 each year.

holidays.name: Juneteenth (substitute)
holidays.description: Juneteenth, also known as Freedom Day and Emancipation Day, is a holiday or observance in many US states to celebrate the anniversary of the abolition of slavery in Texas on June 19, 1865.
